column12: LLANTA O NEUMATICO QUE TIENE PARED LATERAL DECORATIVA
column13: La presente invención se refiere a un método para preparar una llanta de caucho neumática que tiene un diseño decorativo sobre la pared lateral de la misma, que esta caracterizado por (a) aplicar el diseño decorativo a la pared lateral de una llanta no curada y (b) curar la llanta; en donde el diseño decorativo está comprendido de desde aproximadamente 25 a aproximadamente 75 por ciento en peso de 1,2-polibutadieno sindiotáctico que tiene un punto de fusión que eestá dentro del intervalo de aproximadamente 100 grados a aproximadamente 160 grados C y desde aproximadamente 25 en peso a aproximadamente 75 por ciento en peso de por lo menos un caucho de polidieno que es cocurable con el 1,2-polibutadieno sindiotáctico, por lo menos un pigmento o colorante, azufre y óxido de zinc.
column15: GARTLAND ROBERT JOHN;;FINELLI ANTHONY FRANCIS;;BELL ANTHONY JOSEPH

column12: NEUMATICO QUE TIENE UNA PARED LATERAL DECORATIVA.
column13: LAS CUBIERTAS CON PAREDES LATERALES BLANCAS SON MUY POPULARES EN LOS ESTADOS UNIDOS Y CANADA. LAS CUBIERTAS CON LETRAS BLANCAS EN SUS LATERALES SON TAMBIEN MUY POPULARES. ESTE INVENTO REVELA UN PROCEDIMIENTO PARA PREPARAR TALES CUBIERTAS CON APLICACIONES DECORATIVAS SOBRE LAS MISMAS. MEDIANTE EL PROCEDIMIENTO DE ESTE INVENTO, PUEDEN FABRICARSE CUBIERTAS MAS UNIFORMES Y DE MENOR COSTE QUE LAS TECNICAS UTILIZADAS PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE CUBIERTAS ESTANDAR. ESPECIFICAMENTE ESTE INVENTO SE REFIERE A UN METODO PARA PREPARAR UNA CUBIERTA DE GOMA NEUMATICA CON UN DISEÑO DECORATIVO EN SU PARED LATERAL QUE COMPRENDE (A) APLICAR EL DISEÑO DECORATIVO SOBRE LA PARED LATERAL EN UNA CUBIERTA NO CURADA Y (B) CURAR LA CUBIERTA; DONDE EL DISEÑO DECORATIVO COMPORENDE DESDE APROXIMADAMENTE 25 POR CIENTO EN PESO A APROXIMADAMETNE 75 POR CIENTO EN PESO DE 1,2-POLIBUTADIENO SINDIOTACTICO CON UN PUNTO DE FUSION COMPRENDIDO ENTRE 100 C Y 160 C Y DESDE APROXIMADAMENTE 25 POR CIENTO EN PESO Y APROXIMADAMENTE 75POR CIENTO EN PESO DE POR LO MENOS UNA GOMA DE POLIDIENO QUE PUEDE CURARSE EN CONJUNTO CON EL MENCIONADO 1,2-POLIBUTADIENO SINDIOTACTICO, POR LO MENOS UN PIGMENTO O COLORANTE, AZUFRE Y OXIDO DE ZINC.
column15: GARTLAND, ROBERT JOHN;;FINELLI, ANTHONY FRANCIS;;BELL, ANTHONY JOSEPH

column12: Tire having decorative sidewall.
column13: Tires having white sidewalls are very popular in the United States and Canada. Tires having white lettering thereon are also very popular. This invention discloses a process for preparing such tires having decorative appliques thereon. By practicing the process of this invention, tires having better uniformity can be built at lower costs than when standard tire building techniques are utilized. This invention specifically relates to a method of preparing a pneumatic rubber tire having a decorative design on the sidewall thereof which comprises (a) applying the decorative design to the sidewall of an uncured tire and (b) curing the tire; wherein the decorative design is comprised of from about 25 weight percent to about 75 weight percent syndiotactic 1,2-polybutadiene having a melting point which is within the range of about 100°C to about 160°C and from about 25 weight percent to about 75 weight percent of at least one polydiene rubber which is cocurable with said syndiotactic 1,2-polybutadiene, at least one pigment or colorant, sulfur, and zinc oxide.
column15: GARTLAND ROBERT JOHN;;FINELLI ANTHONY FRANCIS;;BELL ANTHONY JOSEPH

column12: Method for applying an applique on the sidewall of a cured tire
column13: Tires having white sidewalls are very popular in the United States and Canada. This invention discloses a process for preparing such tires having decorative appliques thereon. By practicing the process of this invention, tires having better uniformity can be built at lower costs than when standard tire building techniques are utilized. This invention specifically relates to a method of preparing a pneumatic rubber tire having a decorative applique on the sidewall thereof which comprises (a) applying the decorative applique to the sidewall of a cured tire and (b) binding the decorative applique to the sidewall by the application of heat and pressure; wherein the decorative applique is comprised of from about 25 weight percent to about 75 weight percent syndiotactic 1,2-polybutadiene or blends of SPBD having melting points which are within the range of about 70.degree. C. to about 160.degree. C. and from about 25 weight percent to about 75 weight percent of at least one polydiene rubber which is blended with said syndiotactic 1,2-polybutadiene, sulfur, zinc oxide and at least one pigment or colorant.
column15: GARTLAND ROBERT J;;FINELLI ANTHONY F;;BELL ANTHONY J

column12: Means for and method of providing a fire protection for a caseless ammunition
column13: This invention is directed to the concept of providing fire protection for a caseless ammunition round by enveloping the round in an intumescent material. Means for stripping the intumescent material from the round, together with means for connecting a round to an adjacent round for forming a belt, are described.
column15: COCOZELLA ROBERT A;;DAL PAN FLORINDO F;;FINELLI THOMAS M;;PATTERSON DUANE M
